list.abs: ...tenting 斜张天幕;海冰受挤压拱起成帐幕状tenuity factor 稀薄因子tenuity 稀薄

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin tenuitas, from tenuis 'thin'

means.word_mean: 1. relatively small dimension through an object as opposed to its length or width;
2. the quality of lacking intensity or substance;

sentences.sentence: "a shrill yet sweet tenuity of voice"- Nathaniel Hawthorne

auth_sentence.content: The tenuity of the thread by which his future hung.
auth_sentence.res_content: The tenuity of the thread by which his future hung.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tenuity of the thread by which his future hung.

auth_sentence.content: Air may be expanded to an indefinite degree of tenuity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Air may be expanded to an indefinite degree of tenuity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Air may be expanded to an indefinite degree of tenuity.
